meanings.definition: Authorized or accepted as a standard or rule.
meanings.sent1: The teacher only accepted answers written in the canonicals format.
meanings.sent2: The company followed the canonicals procedure for quality control.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to wear the canonicals hat, thinking it was the official uniform.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and clear as the canonicals sky.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell ringing was the canonicals signal for the end of class.

meanings.definition: A collection of writings that are considered authoritative or authentic.
meanings.sent1: The library had a section dedicated to historical canonicals.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the canonicals of famous authors.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a mysterious note hidden among the canonicals.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a treasure trove of canonicals waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed ancient canonicals from different civilizations.

meanings.definition: The established body of rules, principles, or standards in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The team followed the canonicals of fair play in every match.
meanings.sent2: The legal system is based on a set of canonicals that guide decisions.
meanings.sent3: The chef broke the canonicals of baking by adding a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were a rebellion against the canonicals of traditional ballet.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work challenged the canonicals of art with its unique style.
